instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: this board had a spill and i thoroughly cleaned it.  it show 20v 0.000a on the amp meter. the ppbus is 12.67v

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message:
Any other relevant voltage from this MLB?
Like G3S, AWAKE, SLPS2R...

Did you try DFU mode?

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: it's also charging the battery. Couldn't I assume these voltages are there if the ppbus is correct?

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message:
Why do you bother with PPBUS_G3H if even battery is charging?
A problem on battery bus will impede charing battery and also blocks the correct control of PPBUS_G3H voltage.

"Did you try DFU mode?"
???

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: after restoring with dfu i'm getting the apple with the progress bar and configurator gives an error. the device stays in "recovery"

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: I get the apple configurator error as soon as the apple and progress bar shows.  do you know where i can the u4770 image?

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message:
Do you get progress bar on the target machine?
No need to maintain AC2 then.

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: yes the target machine powers on during the ac2 restore and that error immediately pops up. it powers off when the usb-c data cable is unplugged

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: Which area has been affected by liquid?

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: i'm not sure what parts was affected by liquid. it was thoroughly cleaned soon after i received it. it stays in this recovery mode and a restore will make it power up but with the error. i'm using a usb type A port on a 2014 mac mini.  Maybe that could that be an issue

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: i was waiting on a trackpad ribbon that i ordered for it.   According to [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL], the trackpad has to be connected so i'm pretty sure this is the problem

threads.title: 820-00850-a  20v 0.000a 12.67 ppbus
threads.message: TP must work correctly, or KB will not work.
